item.title: Black Lives Matter 5280DiDi Rose is with DiDi Delgado.Tell a Black woman she looks beautiful today. That she‚Äôs a good person. mother....
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280DiDi Rose is with DiDi Delgado.

Tell a Black woman she looks beautiful today.

That she‚Äôs a good person. mother. partner. asset.

Tell a Black woman that you love her and are committed to showin...g her that love with your actions.

Offer us a couple of hours to free our selves and relax by cleaning, cooking, watching children, researching.

Reach out to one of us and thank us for our labor. Reach out to a Black woman and ask for her PayPal/cashapp/Venmo so you can send her something for self care or to put something on a bill.

Tell us you see us.

Tell us you need us.

Do better by us.

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: ‚ÄúHey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúHey community,

An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home, bashed in her windows, broke the counter tops, broke her bed, poured bleach on her clothing, strategically placed butcher knives throughout the home and pulled out the alarms. Can you imagine what he was planning to do to her or her children? Fortunately, she didn't come that night because of a family emergency (more like God and her angels were working overtime!). This fundraiser is an attempt to make her home whole again by fixing the damage. Can you help?‚Äù

Hey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,‚Ä¶ Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic Violence

gofundme.com

Rebuilding After Domestic Violence, organized by Millete Birhanemaskel

Hey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,‚Ä¶ Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic ViolenceHey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,‚Ä¶ Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic Violence

item.title: ‚òïÔ∏è Tweet from @YoloAkili: ‚ÄúI really hate how suicide...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚òïÔ∏è

Tweet from @YoloAkili: ‚ÄúI really hate how suicide prevention month every year is reduced to ‚Äúcheck on your friends‚Äù and not universal health care, to defund the police, accessible mental health services, and peer support programs. That analysis is so corny.‚Äù

Project LETS

Suicide prevention month can be extremely difficult for people with lived experience, those who‚Äôve attempted, those who‚Äôve lost folks. When y‚Äôall don‚Äôt include ...us in your campaigns, we can tell ü§î When y‚Äôall use the same tired lines, we are unaffected. When y‚Äôall tell us to reach out for help, we‚Äôve tried. Suicide is not an individual phenomenon. It is collective. It is political. It is on ALL OF US to create a world that people want to live in. Where people feel safe and valued. Where people have access to basic needs. Posting a crisis line number without structural change is meaningless. Let‚Äôs do the real work.

STAY TUNED: In a few weeks, Project LETS will be facilitating a panel discussion ‚Äî Suicide is Political. More soon.

Tweet from @YoloAkili: ‚ÄúI really hate how suicide prevention month every year is reduced to ‚Äúcheck on your friends‚Äù and not universal health care, to defund the police, accessible mental health services, and peer support programs. That analysis is so corny.‚Äù

We know...

The report, released Thursday, contradicts assumptions and claims by some that protests associated with the Black Lives Matter movement are spawning violence and destruction of property.

cnn.com

About 93% of racial justice protests in the US have been peaceful, a new report finds

The report, released Thursday, contradicts assumptions and claims by some that protests associated with the Black Lives Matter movement are spawning violence and destruction of property.The report, released Thursday, contradicts assumptions and claims by some that protests associated with the Black Lives Matter movement are spawning violence and destruction of property.

item.title: ‚ÄúWe hear you and we know what an emotional, physical drain it...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúWe hear you and we know what an emotional, physical drain it is to be in a black body.

Let‚Äôs create some space to release, gain, and take action.

This workshop is for you. It‚Äôs for us.

...

Learn self-care skills while we navigate this revolution.

Let‚Äôs find spaces to rest because we are TIRED.

This workshop is for BIPOC community and is lead by the amazing Jalisa Williams and will be rewarding for those who attend.
Exchange is 18 a person so please take advantage of this much-needed connection and share with a friend!

Use this link to sign up!
https://share.fitdegree.com/?e=1744‚Äù

FRI, SEP 18 AT 6:30 PM MDT

Black and Tired a workshop on self care and community

item.title: For the past 4 months we at @Denver Homeless Out Loud have...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

For the past 4 months we at @Denver Homeless Out Loud have been paying for port-a-potties at 5 different encampments where people live on the streets with otherwise no access to a bathroom. We have asked the City to fulfill their responsibility and place portable toilets, handwashing stations, and trash cans at every encampment and they have continued to refuse. So we as a small community organization have had to front the bill for the few we could afford.

Thanks to a $25k ...grant from the Colorado Health Foundation for emergency COVID needs, we were able pay for 5 portable toilets, supplies for handwashing stations (in collaboration with Mutual Aid Denver (MAD), trash cans and bags for each toilet, sharps boxes, and compensation for people living on those blocks to clean the toilet units every day.

But we have now run out of those funds.

In order to keep providing the sanitation resources at encampments, we need some serious funding for this project ASAP!!

As long as the City continues to refuse to do their job, someone has to step up to do it for them. We need your help to make this possible.

In order to continue to run these port-a-potties and sanitation resources for the remainder of 2020 we need at least $25k. If we do not get at least 5k by September we will not be able to continue these resources. It costs us just over $800 a month for each regular portable toilet, and $1000 for an ADA toilet, plus moving charges after police sweeps, plus the pay for someone from the encampment to do an extra cleaning of it each day, plus cleaning supplies and supplies to build and maintain the handwashing stations.

See More

denverhomelessoutloud.org

Donate

Here are some ways you can help with the finances‚Ä¶ 1. Come to a meeting and drop off a donation We meet every Wednesday 4:45-7:00P At our office at 2260 California St We would love to m‚Ä¶Here are some ways you can help with the finances‚Ä¶ 1. Come to a meeting and drop off a donation We meet every Wednesday 4:45-7:00P At our office at 2260 California St We would love to m‚Ä¶

item.title: #CallToAction...
item.content:encoded:
#CallToAction
HAPPENING NOW: Your mayor and council members are meeting to discuss the 2-year contract with #DenverPoliceDepartment that increases their budget in the second year. This budget increase allows for MORE funds devoted to the chemical weapons they terrorize our city with! They plan to quietly vote on it tomorrow 9/3 with only online public comment that they can control the narrative on with the click of a button. Contact your council member and Michael B. Hancock TODAY and let them know as their constituent you DEMAND they do not support the following:

‚ùåAny Collective Bargaining Agreement with DPD longer than 1 year.

‚ùåAny agreement that gives ANY financial increases or incentives to police.

‚ùåAny agreement that does not require police to be financially responsible for their attorneys and settlements in any cases of alleged excessive force or race related discrimination

#DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
item.content:encoded: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
item.content:encoded:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
